title: I am currently applying for a job as a researcher or military reporter for a relatively prevalent publication in Colorado Springs. I did a call back and the chances for me getting the job are looking pretty good. This is my first staffer position I\'m applying for, which brings up concerns. Last year, I was charged with two DWAIs. Is it likely that this employer, or any journalism related job, will run a background check on me?
text:
Journalists hired by the The New York Times Co. first must undergo
background checks and substance abuse screening. Policies at other
news organizations might vary.
